skill.name: suggesting-tooling
skill.description:
Analyzes a codebase and suggests custom Claude Code skills and subagents to improve
development workflow. Use when user wants tooling suggestions, automation ideas, or
asks "what skills would help this project".
skill.summary:
Analyzes a codebase and suggests custom Claude Code skills and subagents to improve
development work...
skill.author: BrendanShields

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill with no executable code. Contains only markdown guides and pattern definitions. All shell commands in documentation are examples for user execution, not automated by the skill. No network calls, no credential access, no filesystem operations.

content.value_statement: Users struggle to discover which custom tooling would benefit their workflow. This skill analyzes your codebase patterns and recommends skills and agents tailored to your project. It identifies gaps in automation and suggests specific tooling with priority and rationale.
actual_capabilities: Detect programming languages and frameworks in codebase
Identify testing, linting, and deployment tooling patterns
Match detected patterns to recommended skill templates
Match detected patterns to recommended agent templates
Present suggestions with priority levels and rationale
Generate approved tooling using creating-skills and creating-agents skills
limitations: Does not execute or install suggested tooling automatically
Requires explicit user approval before generating new skills or agents
Limited to maximum 5 suggestions per category (skills and agents)

use_cases.title: Discover automation tools
use_cases.description: Analyze new codebase to find which custom skills and agents would improve your development workflow.

use_cases.title: Standardize team tooling
use_cases.description: Identify missing automation for team workflows like testing, code review, and deployment across your projects.

use_cases.title: Fill tooling gaps
use_cases.description: Detect areas lacking automation and suggest skills to reduce repetitive manual tasks in existing projects.

prompt_templates.title: Analyze project
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze this codebase and suggest custom Claude Code skills and agents that would improve the development workflow.

prompt_templates.title: Check existing
prompt_templates.prompt: Compare my current .claude configuration against detected project patterns. What tooling am I missing?

prompt_templates.title: Generate skill
prompt_templates.prompt: A testing-code skill would help this project. Generate it using detected patterns: Jest framework, TypeScript, tests directory.

prompt_templates.title: Prioritize suggestions
prompt_templates.prompt: Prioritize the suggested skills and agents by impact. Which ones would save the most time if automated?

output_examples.input: Analyze this Python FastAPI project with pytest and suggest tooling
output: Gap analysis: No existing testing automation, no API test coverage

output_examples.input: Check my current .claude configuration against my React project with TypeScript and Jest
output: Priority P1: testing-code for Jest test execution
Priority P3: linting-code if pre-commit is already configured

output_examples.input: What skills would help my Node.js Express project with database migrations
output: Recommended agents: api-testing (P1) for Express routes

best_practices: Run analysis on fresh projects early to establish automation baseline
Review P1 suggestions first as they have highest impact on workflow
Check for overlap with existing .claude tooling before generating new items
anti_patterns: Suggesting generic skills without project-specific detected patterns
Generating tooling without getting explicit user approval first
Duplicating Claude built-in capabilities instead of specialized tools
Skipping overlap detection with existing skills and agents

faq.question: What tools does this skill work with?
faq.answer: Supports Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Provides recommendations for custom skills and agents compatible with all three platforms.

faq.question: How many suggestions does it generate?
faq.answer: Maximum of 5 suggestions per category. Suggestions are prioritized by impact level with P1, P2, P3 ratings.

faq.question: Does it install the suggested tooling?
faq.answer: No. The skill presents suggestions and rationale. Users must approve generation. New tooling requires restart to become available.

faq.question: Is my code data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. This is a prompt-based skill with no executable code. It only reads project structure for pattern detection.

faq.question: Why are no suggestions showing?
faq.answer: The skill only suggests when it detects clear patterns like jest.config for testing or Dockerfile for deployment. Add more project files matching pattern categories.

faq.question: How is this different from built-in agents?
faq.answer: Built-in agents are general-purpose. This skill recommends specialized automation tailored to your specific project patterns and detected workflows.
